timeline.bodyText:
Please create a new environment, MultinodeHiveCaching

multinode is not supposed to be "include everything" environment (Iceberg shouldn't be here too)
in this new environment you can register the catalog as hive and run all storage_formats, which greatly improves fs coverage
timeline.author: findepi
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -70,7 +74,9 @@ protected void extendEnvironment(Environment.Builder builder)
         builder.configureContainer("presto-master", container -> {
             container
                     .withFileSystemBind(dockerFiles.getDockerFilesHostPath("conf/environment/multinode/multinode-master-jvm.config"), CONTAINER_PRESTO_JVM_CONFIG, READ_ONLY)
-                    .withFileSystemBind(dockerFiles.getDockerFilesHostPath("conf/environment/multinode/multinode-master-config.properties"), CONTAINER_PRESTO_CONFIG_PROPERTIES, READ_ONLY);
+                    .withFileSystemBind(dockerFiles.getDockerFilesHostPath("conf/environment/multinode/multinode-master-config.properties"), CONTAINER_PRESTO_CONFIG_PROPERTIES, READ_ONLY)
+                    .withFileSystemBind(dockerFiles.getDockerFilesHostPath("common/hadoop/hivecached.properties"), CONTAINER_PRESTO_HIVE_CACHED_PROPERTIES, READ_ONLY)

timeline.bodyText:
I guess most of the are not needed?
Please leave only those that are important
timeline.author: findepi

timeline.bodyText:
getCachedReads method doesn't really know what it is doing, it could be called getFirstColumn
Similarly getRemoteReads could be called getSecondColumn.
Use tryFindColumnIndex to map columns by name.
timeline.author: findepi

timeline.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                        throws InterruptedException
          
          
            
                        throws Exception
timeline.author: findepi

timeline.bodyText: use form of assert eventually, otherwise this will likely be flaky
timeline.author: findepi

timeline.bodyText: call this file  hive.properties (corresponding to the file name it ends up being mounted at)
timeline.author: findepi

timeline.bodyText:
missing comma after hive_cache
instead of changing here, tag the caching tests with profile_specific_tests
timeline.author: findepi

timeline.bodyText: I think suite-1 is the longest. Can you confirm and pick a different suite?
timeline.author: findepi
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -6,7 +6,12 @@ suite_exit_code=0
 
 presto-product-tests-launcher/bin/run-launcher test run \
     --environment multinode \
-    -- -x quarantine,big_query,storage_formats,profile_specific_tests,tpcds,cassandra,mysql,postgresql,kafka,hive_compression,"${DISTRO_SKIP_GROUP}" \
+    -- -x quarantine,big_query,storage_formats,profile_specific_tests,tpcds,cassandra,mysql,postgresql,kafka,hive_compression,hive_cache"${DISTRO_SKIP_GROUP}" \
+    || suite_exit_code=1
+
+presto-product-tests-launcher/bin/run-launcher test run \
+    --environment multinode-hive-caching \
+    -- -g hive_cache,storage_formats \

timeline.author: findepi

timeline.bodyText: i think this should be part of storage_formats group (no need for new group), especially if it exploits new way of interacting between presto, file format, and file system.
timeline.author: findepi

replies.bodyText:
i think this should be part of storage_formats group (no need for new group),

Avro tests are still part of storage_formats. This group allows to exclude avro tests until #3794 is fixed (there is also TODO in bin/product-tests-suite-5.sh)
replies.author: sopel39

replies.bodyText:
Some are. But some are not (presto-product-tests/src/main/java/io/prestosql/tests/hive/TestAvroSchemaUrl.java, presto-product-tests/src/main/java/io/prestosql/tests/hive/TestAvroSchemaEvolution.java)
maybe those two shouldnt' be storage_formats though
replies.author: findepi

replies.bodyText: oh, the TestAvroSchemaUrl should be. Please add
replies.author: findepi
